Questions.Question: When was the first telephone patented?
Questions.Explanation: The first telephone was patented by Alexander Graham Bell on March 7, 1876, revolutionizing communication.

Questions.Question: Who invented the World Wide Web?
Questions.Explanation: Tim Berners-Lee, a British computer scientist, invented the World Wide Web in 1989, changing the information age.

Questions.Question: What year was the first computer mouse invented?
Questions.Explanation: The first computer mouse, invented by Doug Engelbart, was publicly unveiled in 1968, becoming an essential peripheral.

Questions.Question: In what year was the printing press invented?
Questions.Explanation: In 1440, Johannes Gutenberg introduced the mechanical movable-type printing press, revolutionizing the spread of information.

Questions.Question: Who invented the first practical telephone?
Questions.Explanation: Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first practical telephone in 1876, impacting global communication.

Questions.Question: What year did the first electronic programmable computer debut?
Questions.Explanation: The first electronic programmable computer, the Colossus, was developed in 1943, marking a significant technological milestone.

Questions.Question: Which year was the first commercial cell phone released?
Questions.Explanation: The DynaTAC 8000X was the first commercially available cell phone, released by Motorola in 1983, revolutionizing mobile communication.

Questions.Question: Who invented the first computer?
Questions.Explanation: Considered the 'father of the computer,' Charles Babbage designed the first general-purpose mechanical computer in the 1830s.

Questions.Question: What year was the first digital camera invented?
Questions.Explanation: In 1975, Steve Sasson invented the first digital camera, revolutionizing the way images are captured and stored.

Questions.Question: Which year was the first commercially available personal computer released?
Questions.Explanation: The Altair 8800, released in 1975, was the first commercially successful personal computer, spurring the microcomputer revolution.

Questions.Question: Who is considered the inventor of the radio?
Questions.Explanation: Guglielmo Marconi achieved the first successful transatlantic wireless telegraphy transmission and is credited with inventing the radio.

Questions.Question: What year was the first modern electric car developed?
Questions.Explanation: General Motors released the EV1, the first modern electric car, in 1996, pioneering the modern electric vehicle market.

Questions.Question: Who is known for developing the first successful airplane?
Questions.Explanation: Orville and Wilbur Wright are credited with achieving the first successful powered flight in 1903, propelling aviation development.

Questions.Question: What year did the first commercial jet airliner enter service?
Questions.Explanation: The de Havilland Comet, the first commercial jet airliner, entered service in 1952, revolutionizing air travel.

Questions.Question: Who invented the first practical steam engine for industrial use?
Questions.Explanation: James Watt's improvements to the steam engine in the late 18th century drove the Industrial Revolution and transformed industry.

Questions.Question: What year was the first modern smartphone introduced?
Questions.Explanation: Apple's iPhone, released in 2007, set a new standard for smartphones, combining powerful technology with user-friendly design.

Questions.Question: Who developed the first successful motion-picture camera?
Questions.Explanation: Thomas Edison's team invented the Kinetograph in 1891, pioneering motion-picture technology and early filmmaking.

Questions.Question: In what year was the first digital computer introduced?
Questions.Explanation: The Electronic Numerical Integrator and Computer (ENIAC) was unveiled in 1943, marking the birth of the digital computer age.

Questions.Question: Who is credited with inventing the first successful lightbulb?
Questions.Explanation: Thomas Edison's incandescent light bulb, patented in 1879, revolutionized illumination and modernized daily life.

Questions.Question: What year was the World's first web browser introduced?
Questions.Explanation: Sir Tim Berners-Lee invented the first web browser and editor, WorldWideWeb, in 1990, shaping the early internet experience.
